original: Dahllöf, Sigurd, författare, Göteborg, f. 5/5/77 i Trollhättan av skogs-chefen, jägmäst. Tell D. o. Tekla Berggren. G. 27 m. Karin Hansson. Barn: Urban f. 28. — Priv. stud. samt stud. v. Gävle borgisk. Bokhåll. v. Sandvikens Jernverks A-B 94, v. See Fabr. A-B där 00, kontxhef h. sped:firma Ax. Hofstedt i Gbg 02-07, h. A-B Hallins Konsthand. 07-09, uteslut, förf. 09-19, anisit. v. Gbgs haminarb :kiont. 19-42, Medl. av Svies förfrfören. o. Gbgs förf rsällsk. Skr.: diktsaml.: Långt bortom åsarna, Furor, Lust o. längtan. Blomvers, Trollslända, Jungfru Marie hand (20), Göteborgsbilder (24); sa-go- o. novellsamd.: Brudkronan, Stor-styggen, Vänersagor, S :ta Lucias gåva. Otyg o. äventyr, Havsåsen, I skumrasket, Sagor o. äventyr (19, 22), Färjan (20), Pojken fr. sjön (24), Bortom hank o. stör (43), medarb. i huv:-stads- o. landsortspressen. Hobby: astronomi. PatrstGM.
translated: Dahllöf, Sigurd, writer, Gothenburg, born May 5, 1877, in Trollhättan to the chief forester, forestry inspector Tell D. and Tekla Berggren. Married since 1927 to Karin Hansson, with a son named Urban, born in 1928. Dahllöf had private studies and studied at Gävle Borgisk. He worked as an accountant at Sandvikens Jernverks A-B in 1894 and at See Fabr. A-B in 1900, later becoming chief accountant at Ax. Hofstedt forwarding firm in Gothenburg from 1902 to 1907, then at A-B Hallins Art Gallery from 1907 to 1909. Excluded, he became a writer from 1909 to 1919 and finally an assistant at the Gothenburg Harbor Commission from 1919 to 1942. He was a member of the Swedish Writers' Association and the Gothenburg Authors' Association. He wrote several collections of poems, including "Långt bortom åsarna," "Furor, Lust o. längtan," "Blomvers," "Trollslända," "Jungfru Marie hand" (1920), "Göteborgsbilder" (1924); and collections of fairy tales and short stories, including "Brudkronan," "Stor-styggen," "Vänersagor," "S :ta Lucias gåva," "Otyg o. äventyr," "Havsåsen," "I skumrasket," "Sagor o. äventyr" (1919, 1922), "Färjan" (1920), "Pojken fr. sjön" (1924), and "Bortom hank o. stör" (1943). He also contributed to newspapers in both the capital and rural areas. His hobby was astronomy. PatrstGM.

structured.name: Sigurd Dahllöf
structured.description: Sigurd Dahllöf was a Swedish writer known for his works of poetry, fairy tales and short stories. He was also a member of the Swedish Writers' Association and the Gothenburg Authors' Association. Dahllöf was born on May 5, 1877, in Trollhättan, Sweden to Tell D. and Tekla Berggren, both of whom were in the forestry profession. He married Karin Hansson in 1927 and had a son named Urban in 1928. Dahllöf worked as an accountant at Sandvikens Jernverks A-B, See Fabr. A-B, Ax. Hofstedt forwarding firm, and A-B Hallins Art Gallery. He later became a writer and an assistant at the Gothenburg Harbor Commission. Dahllöf was also an amateur astronomer.
